description: 14th c., from Middle English culp, culpe, kilp, but of unknown ultimate origin.

entries.meaning: Any of several large brown algae seaweeds (order Laminariales).
The calcined ashes of seaweed, formerly used in glass and iodine manufacture.

verbs.description: kelp (third-person singular simple present kelps, present participle kelping, simple past and past participle kelped)

examples: Just before we reached Seward the pilot got a radio message that a fishing boat in Thumb Cove had some kelp  [â€¦]  Neither of us had ever kelped before but there wasn't much to it, and we started bringing in full boxes back to Eads' barge.
